title: waving
text:
backlit ocean
waves in the sun
shine water cave
I came, I gave, I went
I came back again
little wave, my life in
another man’s palm
waves, hello, good bye
which way goes the wave
forwards back side to side

the direction of the sun’s shine
goes just as far to the other skies

our horizon line straight as a steady eye

bird song in the afternoon time
sun kisses sea shine
the wind moves little things lightly
the waves come each and every one closer 
closer to sky
I came, I gave, I am wave
waving hi bye

quiet in the house
outside do the birds breathe?
he is on the train
is it real, this wave? this sea?

do we say hello
just to say goodbye? 
I lose my nerves across the world 
the door stays still
time moves my heart
the breeze touches my knees
cool as fresh peas
maybe I will die here
in time for him to kiss my cooling cheek

the waves, the birds, the sun's light
don’t stop don’t start just right just right
